entry.title: Re: How Can I transfer data from One client to another /s...
entry.content:
Hello @sonia260165 

The data is kept in the /SCWM/STADET_OUT which has delivery class = A (master and application data)

The standard way is manual maintenance in the destination system.

If you are savvy transport system, you can add /SCWM/STADET_OUT entries manually to a transport with R3TR TABU object. Be sure to know what you are doing, if you chose this option.

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: Hu is getting created for me, but i cant pack stock i...
entry.content:
When you create a discussion and expecting some inputs from this forum, please see that you create the discussion with as much information as possible so that, it will be easy for the members to understand the issue. You have not even added the issue in the text. Just by reading the subject alone is not suffice to assist you.

In order to understand better whether it is because of process issue or configuration issue, please clarify the following:

  • Are you working in an outbound or inbound delivery because, the packing logic differs between the two.
  • Is the HU created manually or automatically during the process? This will determine if it is a config or process issue.
  • What error message you were getting when trying to pack the stock ? Please share a screen shot of that error message
  • Is the material HU-managed in the material master?

entry.title: Re: oDataService Request is called multiple times
entry.content:
Hi AnilTripathy, As I guess in your controller check below statement is there anywhere.

This.getView().getModel().refresh() or
This.getOwnerComponent.getModel().refresh()

These statements may not effect in Dev environment some times because of oData model versions,
in higher environments, Some cases I have observed issue with these statements.

Resolution:
Handle them with Named model refresh in controllers.

entry.title: Re: Skipping popup messages in VA03 for Sales Order Incom...
entry.content:
To reduce unnecessary popups, you need to identify and remove fields from the incompletion procedure that:

  • are not essential for your business process
  • Do not impact downstream activities (like delivery, billing, or reporting)

This way, SAP won’t flag those fields as incomplete, and users won’t be bombarded with popups.

Needless to mention, SAP does not retroactively re-evaluate open documents when you change the incompletion procedure. That means documents already flagged as incomplete will remain incomplete until manually edited or reprocessed.

entry.title: Re: Automatic payment block for non PO invoice
entry.content:
To meet your requirements:

  • avoid global SSCUI SSCUI 104420 and 104419 thresholds. They’re too blunt.
  • Use Flexible Workflow (WS00800251) conditions to differentiate invoice types. The condition can be Purchase Order Reference = Empty for FI invoices. For MM invoices, use Condition Invoice Block Reason = Price/Quantity Variance.
  • Implement BAdI logic via MRM_PAYMENT_BLOCK to apply payment blocks only when needed.
  • Optionally use validation rules via OB28, for FI invoices to enforce the payment block. This works well for FI invoices posted via FB60 or Fiori apps

entry.title: SAP API Management - APIKey and Response Caching
entry.content:
Introduction :

What is Caching ?

In API Management, response caching allows us to deliver much faster responses to users by storing the results of repeated requests in the cache. This way, the backend doesn’t need to be invoked for every request, reducing unnecessary load on the system. As a result, performance increases, latency decreases, and backend resources are utilized more efficiently.

Scenario :

Caching doesn’t always mean storing the entire dataset. With query parameters, we can cache only the specific results that users request. In this scenario, the user makes an API call by defining certain conditions through query parameters, and the system responds faster by serving the cached result that matches those conditions.

Step 1: Create API Proxy 

Configure --> APIs --> API Proxies --> Create

Note : The first step is usually to create an API provider; however, in my proxy I will not be using a provider. Instead, I will connect to the backend system directly via its URL.

Step 2: Create Product

Engage--> Products --> Create

It’s not mandatory to create a product for every process; however, since we want the user to trigger our API with an API key, we need to create a product.

If we want, we can set quotas for our APIs. This is something we can define ourselves. For example, in this case I am adding a rule that allows up to 100 requests to this API within 10 months.

Step 3: Create Application

I am connecting to the Developer Hub from the Integration Suite screen. And I can see the products I created earlier.

Workspace --> Create

 

 

In this way, we have created an application key linked to this product.

Step 4: Policies

We create API proxies to manage aspects such as security, performance, and routing. These controls are implemented through policies.

In this scenario, I implemented the user’s access to the API via an API key, as well as the caching process, through policies.

VerifyAPIKey: 

With this policy, we define the rule that allows access only if the user includes the API key created in the Developer Hub within the request header.

<VerifyAPIKey async='true' continueOnError='false' enabled='true' 
xmlns='http://www.sap.com/apimgmt'>
<APIKey ref='request.header.x-api-key'/>
</VerifyAPIKey>

Caching:

I don’t necessarily have to specify a query, but I used it here to make the scenario more specific. Users may not always send requests without queries, and this needs to be taken into account. Therefore, you can use any query parameters you wish to include.

I set the caching duration to 3600 seconds.

<ResponseCache async="false" continueOnError="false" enabled="true" xmlns="http://www.sap.com/apimgmt">
<CacheKey>
<KeyFragment ref="request.queryparam.$filter"/>
<KeyFragment ref="request.queryparam.$select"/>
<KeyFragment ref="request.queryparam.$top"/>
<KeyFragment ref="request.queryparam.$expand"/>
<KeyFragment ref="request.queryparam.$skip"/>
<KeyFragment ref="request.path"/>
</CacheKey>
<Scope>Exclusive</Scope>
<ExpirySettings>
<TimeoutInSec>3600</TimeoutInSec>
</ExpirySettings>

</ResponseCache>

 

So how can I tell whether the data is coming from the cache or from the backend system? I previously mentioned that the purpose of caching is to return responses faster. When you trigger the API from Postman or any other system, you can check the response time. We will test this in the next step. Additionally, you can add a JavaScript code to your policy. If the timestamp does not change, you can conclude that the data was served from the cache.

 

var response = context.getVariable("response.content");

var serverTime = new Date().toISOString();

var updatedResponse = serverTime+response


context.setVariable("response.content", updatedResponse);

 

Note: Since the other policies are related to the authentication of the service I want to access, I will not cover them here in order to stay on topic and avoid confusion. I will write a separate blog post about authentication policies in API Management. 

For that reason, I will not go into the get token and set token steps.

Step 5 : Testing

As shown in the two test cases below, I can retrieve data from the API using the API key parameter sent in the request header. The first example is the initial call to the backend system, with a response time of 4.09 seconds. The second example returns the same query from the cache rather than the backend, with a response time of 431 ms.

 

Summary :

Response caching delivers faster response times—improving user experience, especially for mobile users—while lowering backend load on SAP Graph or other backend systems. It also drives cost savings by avoiding redundant calls to pay-per-use services, increases API-quota efficiency by preventing rate-limit hits from repeated queries, and improves stability by allowing responses to continue even during backend outages.

Thank you.

Deniz.

entry.title: Re: SD document 212345 is not in the database or has been...
entry.content:
Since you have confirmed that the issue is only with one material, couple of options are there which you can explore. They are

  • After saving the order, go to transaction SM13, look for update records related to the user and time of the failed order. If you see a status like “Update Terminated”, click into the record to view the error details.
  • Even if the user doesn’t see a dump, the system might log one. So go to ST22 and filter by date/user. Look for dumps like UPDATE_FAILED, OBJECTS_OBJREF_NOT_ASSIGNED, or custom Z-program errors.
  • Use SLG1 with object SD or VA and subobject ORDER. This can reveal hidden errors or messages that didn’t surface in the UI.
  • Most importantly, since the issue is material specific, I doubt, some custom validation should be there. So, create a sale order again with the problematic material in debug mode, after setting a break-point in MV45AFZZ. If the system does not stop at any value, then, you need to find out which other custom exit is there for material specific. This you can get via SE11, where you input MATNR and click on Where-Used list. This will show all user exits.

entry.title: SAP Maintenance Assistant 2508 Now Available – What’s New?
entry.content:
The SAP Mobile Asset Management team is excited to announce the 2508 release of SAP Maintenance Assistant, the mobile app for maintenance execution with SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This update continues our focus on making technicians more effective in the field — with new form capabilities and expanded integration with SAP Field Service Management (FSM).

Features delivered in the 2408 release

SAP Dynamic Forms on Mobile

SAP Dynamic Forms is now available directly in SAP Maintenance Assistant. Built on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), Dynamic Forms let organizations design digital forms with validation rules, attach them to business objects, and make them available to technicians both online and offline.

On the mobile app, technicians can:

  • Download forms with their assigned work,
  • Save drafts as they go,
  • Submit completed forms once work is finished.

Forms sync back to SAP BTP where data can be mapped to business objects or trigger follow-up actions.

Administration for Dynamic Forms

On the backend, administrators now have ways to manage Dynamic Forms:

  • Dynamic Forms Administration – New Fiori tiles allow configuration and assignment of Dynamic Forms to relevant business objects.
  • Manage Mobile Application Configuration – Introduces new options to configure Dynamic Form Agents which are responsible for handling form operations for a specific business object type.

Expanding the Field Service Technician Persona

In our previous release, we introduced the Field Service Technician persona. With 2508, we’re expanding its capabilities by integrating more deeply with FSM, giving technicians visibility into dispatcher-assigned work and structured service scripts.

FSM Smartform Support

When an FSM dispatcher assigns an activity with a Smartform, the form now appears directly in the Maintenance Assistant item details. Technicians can work through these structured, multi-step scripts to capture inspection results, safety checks, notes, and more — ensuring consistent execution across the field.

FSM Activity and Status Integration

With FSM integration enabled:

  • Activities – Items released by the dispatcher in the FSM Planning & Dispatching Board appear in Maintenance Assistant after sync.
  • Status Updates – Technician updates made in the app are sent back to FSM, so dispatchers always see real-time progress.
  • Location Data – When enabled, the technician’s location syncs back to FSM, helping planners make informed dispatching decisions.

Release available now

SAP Maintenance Assistant is available now. The application is publicly available and includes an offline demo mode for viewing and testing the functionality. The application may be downloaded from the Apple App Store and Google Play Store.

Submit innovation requests

We encourage you to visit the SAP Mobile Service and Asset Management Customer Influence portal to submit improvement requests. Use the SAP Maintenance Assistant for S/4HANA Public Cloud category to properly direct your request.

Explore other SAP mobile applications

SAP has a powerful suite of SAP native mobile applications. Follow the MXE Community for latest updates.

entry.title: Webinar: How SAP partners deliver new countries in SAP Cloud ERP with the CLT
entry.content:
SAP is pleased to announce a dedicated session on the Configuration Localization Tool (CLT), now generally available. This tool marks a significant step forward in enabling localization as a self-service, allowing partners and customers to deliver country- and region-specific compliance where no standard SAP-delivered local version exists.

CLT provides a structured, scalable, and partner-ready framework that simplifies the creation of local compliance content. With this tool, partners can support customers in expanding their geographic footprint efficiently and reliably—unlocking new market opportunities with minimal overhead.

This session is designed for:

  • Localization experts seeking to extend SAP solutions to new regions
  • Implementation partners looking to deliver tailored compliance content
  • Business development leads exploring untapped markets

Participants will gain practical insights into how CLT supports SAP’s strategic globalization agenda and how to leverage it effectively in real-world scenarios.

Session 1: 09:00 AM CET - 10:30 AM CET
Session 2: 04:00 PM CET - 05:30 PM CET

The agenda and registration link are available here.

entry.title: Re: Succession Org Chart Reporting
entry.content:
Hi @Sue-Lhymn,

You could create a report which includes the various fields you would like to see, along with the current nominations attached to the position.

You could then schedule the report to be ran prior to each time their position sync process is ran.

This would then allow you to review the position structure and nominations which existed in the system at the time before the position sync job ran. 

Note: The data would be in a table format and would not be an image like the Succession Org Chart

Thanks,

Michael

entry.title: Re: changing the label count in the app Enter Time Ticket...
entry.content:
Hello @max_tillmann 

Thank you for submitting this request.

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, it is not possible to pass a custom label count field from CO11N into the standard Goods Receipt process in the background (MIGO). The related BAdIs, such as BD_WORKORDER_GOODSMOVT_BKF_GDR and FLOG_CHG_GR_DATA, provide only the label count as read-only parameters and cannot be used to override or change the number of labels. This is standard system behaviour and cannot be modified in the Public Cloud.

Available options instead:

Output Management; Configure label printing rules, e.g copies, conditions in Output Parameter Determination after Goods Receipt posting.

Side-by-Side Extension: Store the custom label count and trigger printing through SAP BTP or an external service once the confirmation is posted.

EWM Scenario if in scope: Manage label quantities through EWM print profiles and packaging specifications.

Currently, there is no supported method to directly adjust the label count within CO11N. The advised approach is to handle printing logic either through Output Management or a side-by-side extension.

Please let us know if you need further information

Best regards,

Chuma Ofole

entry.title: Re: Compare two clients (SAP environments) with SAP Signavio
entry.content:
Hello Jessica, 

let me make some additional comments based on Rada's answer.

1) the plug and gain offering comprises multiple packages which can be deployed invididually in your Signavio workspace. If you want to get a quick overview about a wide range of processes running in your systems, the the Process Landscape Analysis is the right package. If you are interested in dediacted processes such as Lead-to-Cash, there are packages dealing with these processes. From what I hear from your message, the Process Landscape Analysis might be a good starting point.
SAP Help Provides an overview about the content https://help.sap.com/docs/signavio-process-transformation-suite/getting-started-guide-plug-and-gain-approach/what-is-plug-and-gain. 

2) Sognavio Process Intelligence is a generic solution for Process Mining. The data required for doing Process Mining can be retrieved in multiple ways. One way to get data is to re-use data from Process Insights. With this plug and gain approach, it is possible to set up process mining in a very efficient manner, allowing a jump start into mining.

3) When doing the plug and gain approach, data from all systems connected to the Process Insights tenant are transferred into Process Intelligence into 1 single event log. in Process Intelligence This allows you doing a comparison between systems.

4) Each plug and gain package comes with a dedicated set of out-of-the-box dashboards to analyze the data. If you want to have a sneak preview, please refer to the video series (in particular chapter 3 and 4). If you want to enhance the dashboard, you can do this using SIGNAL. The videos also show how Process Insights and Process Intelligence can be used in combination. Especially when you think about System consolidation, Process Insights can be extremely helpful for questions going beyond topics to be treated with Process Mining.

I hope this helps.

Best
Bernd

entry.title: Re: PR quantity in PO
entry.content: You have the option to set it as "Closed" at item level Quantities/Dates tab.   Once this is done, The PR item will not appear in sourcing transactions like ME57 or ME21N.  The remaining quantity will be ignored for further PO creation.  The original PR quantity remains unchanged, preserving your audit trail.

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA AVANCED RETURNS MANAGEMENT : A Guide to Complex Return Setup - PART 1 : Overview
entry.content:
As we know, when heading to return process real life scenario, apart from receiving returns good, there are many scenarios could happen: Return goods could be dismissed at the customers’ site, Return goods could be inspected once again before initiate credit memo for customers, return goods are returned to vendor (in case of 3rd party sales), etc. To handle these situations like that, in complaint process, we usually use normal return process (RE order type) and then proceed the extra process accordingly. However, on S/4 HANA, they introduce Advanced Returns Management, a tool that help at the more complex return scenario.

For short, Advanced Returns Management has flow like below:

+ Customer Return Order
+ Inspection Result
+ Next Logistics-follow up activities
+ Refund Determination

For this writing, we will go through normal process with field explained, and then we will go through via some basic configurations. Since Advanced Returns Management (ARM) is long process, the blog will be divided into 2 parts : Process and Configurations. This first post will focus on the process at an overview scope.

Overview of our basic Advanced Returns Management (ARM) step as follow:

Step 1. VA01 => creation of ARM
Step 2. PGR Receipt of Return Material
Step 3. Inspection Material
Step 4. Refund Determination => Create Credit Memo Request

Before step in, a transaction code that could be very helpful in this process, that will help you anytime to check your Return process is correct or not, is completed or not completed, is MSR_TRC_C - ARM Overview

Step 1. Creation of ARM order. VA01 => RE2

Here is the brief look of Advanced Returns Management screen (VA01 => Order type RE2)


Let’s go briefly through via Field by field:

a. Return Reason:

Return reason is for us to know the detail reason why we have return reason. This list will may have the impact of how the we refund in the later step.

b. Follow-up Activities :

These Follow-up Activities will decide our next step of the process. As we can see, this is one of important advantages that Advanced Returns Management. This step DOES NOT dictate that the NEXT STEP SHOULD BE, because, material could be inspected, but at least, in the perfect scenario, it will be our next step.

c. Refund Determinations (Refund Type / Refund Control / Return Code) – key advantage of ARM



Refund Type is how we could the initiate the refund process with customers with Credit Memo or Replacement Material.

Next, with the Refund Control, we can know when we should refund customers. Based on how customers histories with the customer or model of business, we can decide (as for now), how we MAY refund customer;



Next is the refund Code. These Refund Code decides % if you want to refund. This one is set just for recommendation because the Refund Code could be affected by how the material is received, quality inspection result. In this case, just set 10% Reduction.



For CMR Rej. Reason, this is just information of Reason for Rejection tab of our future Credit Memo Request 

In the next screen, you can see more detail about the inspection process of the return. Since we do not have any information about our return yet, we do not set it. It could be set later in the step.

So here is our final screen,

Step 2. Return Delivery => Post Good Receipt

After your ARM order is created, based on your Follow-up Act. section that you chose previously on the VA01, the document will be created automatically. In this case, since we choose 0001 Receive into Plant, so there will be an inbound delivery generated to bring back the material from the customers’ site.

The only thing we need to do in this next step is Post Good Receipt. As you can see, we post material in blocked stocks, for further investigations.

Step 3. Material Inspection : MSR_INSPWH => Material Inspection

The next step is Material Inspection. Different persepctive of this Material Inspection/Quality Management  is that this will impact/genrate Follow-up Activities, compares to only Material Document generated after QAxx.

 MSR_INSPWH’s pop-up could be seen below:

Fill in your Return Orders / Delivery and then hit Execute => Then choose Item Level. Header Level could be used but it will aplied to whole list of materials that you received from return, with less detail.

Item level screen could be seen here :

As you can see, this screen supports a lot of different options here. Apart from inspection process (also support Inspection Lot), we can change the refund process from credit memo request to replace material

So, in this case, we will not process anything with the material, since it’s inspected and all good. As I input the Inspection code as 0001 and Follow-up Activities – No Further Activities.

One point is very interesting of this process is that, for 3rd party process or reselling process, we have little tick box that could be very useful. This tickbox will decide that whenever the vendor giving back the credit memo => we will give back the credit memo to customer.

Step 4. MSR_CRD – Customer Refund Determination

As you can see, this step we will help control the refund process

1 – We can split the refund

2- If we click on it => Credit Memo Request will auto generate

3 & 4- This  will based on your configuration. Basically you can choose the order type of SDF (Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge), or order type of credit memo request.

5 – Return Overview => help we have a look overview of our return process

For this next step, we will click on Create Credit Memo Request. This will bring us to another Credit Memo Creation – VA01 screen:

For this one, apart from normal details like normal Credit Memo Request, we also have the “Returns Control” screen, which is copied from RE2 – Advanced Returns Management. Hit Save

Recheck at overview screen:

Next step, we will handle it like any normal Credit Memo Request, VF01 => fill in the Order, hit save

After creation of Credit Memo, come back to check Return Overview, its all green.

We are good to go! Document flow could be seen as below:


Since this blog is too long, the next configuration step will be mentioned at our 2nd part of this blog. Attached link below:

entry.title: How to edit a quota assignment in SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC)?
entry.content:
Symptom: You need to edit (increase or reduce) the quota assignment in SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) for SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere and SAP Databricks. 

Requirements: You need to have purchased SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) and have an S-user with the assigned role for Super Administrator or Cloud Administrator in SAP for Me. 

Resolution: 

1. Open SAP for Me and log in.

2. Navigate to the "Dashboards" section and click "Portfolio & Products".

3. Select "Business Data Cloud" in "My Product Suites".

4. Go to "Solutions", pick the tenant (SAC, SAP Datasphere or SAP Databricks) you want to edit the quota assignment, click in the "..." and then "Edit".

5. A new popup will appear. Click "Next". 

6. Update the quota assignment and then click "Next". In this example, we update for SAP Datasphere, but you can change for SAP Analytics Cloud based on number of users and SAP Databricks on capacity units.

7. Click "Review". 

8. Click "Finish". 

9. See "Updating solution" message and wait for the updates to be finished. 

Image 1

Image 2

Image 3

Image 4

Image 5

Image 6

Image 7

entry.title: Re: Workflow/Report for Customers with Non-Valid SEPA Man...
entry.content:
Hi @Katharinam 

Thank you for your question.

I will walk you through a standard way you can successfully set up the desired solution.

Based on the information you provided and your situation where invoices are being generated for customers with invalid SEPA mandates. Here are the key solutions and approaches available in SAP:

You can take immediate actions to help you by doing the following:

First, make use of transaction FSEPA_M4 to generate the desired mandate lists for your company code with visual status indicators. This will help you quickly identify problematic mandates that require follow-up

Then, implement the F110 payment run's built-in validation which automatically flags cases where "Valid SEPA mandate is not found" during payment proposal processing and hence effectively blocking these transactions

Finally, I suggest you consider activating the direct debit pre-notification functionality which will create waiting periods before actual payment processing and therefore giving you time to resolve mandate issue

 

Incase you are considering Custom Reporting Solutions, consider the following approach:

 

Extract your mandate status information from the SEPA_MANDATE table ease automated reporting

Leverage BAPI SEPA_MANDATES_API_GET for programmatic access to mandate your desired data

Consider implementing BAdI BADI_EBPP_CCP_DATA for your custom mandate selection logic that can help you filter mandates based on your specific business requirements

Here is my summarized workflow recommendation:

Set up your regular monitoring using FSEPA_M3 and FSEPA_M4 transactions to proactively identify invalid mandates before billing runs, then use the customer master data integration to track and resolve mandate status issues directly during customer maintenance activities.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: PR quantity in PO
entry.content:
Hello @Dinesh_158  - 

Use the following steps - 

Use Transaction Code ME52N: Go to the transaction code ME52N to change the Purchase Requisition.

Select the Item: Find the item for which you want to close the remaining quantity.

Set the Item to "Closed": In the item details, you can set the status to "Closed" or use the option to mark the item as "Completed." This will prevent it from appearing in future Purchase Orders (POs) without altering the original quantity of the PR.

Save Changes: After making the necessary changes, save the PR.

By following these steps, the remaining open quantity will not appear when you create a new PO for the same PR, effectively closing the PR item without changing its quantity.

 

Thanks,

Ankur

entry.title: Re: SAP MII vs SAP DM
entry.content: Your post was very clear

entry.title: Re: Workflow/Report for Customers with Non-Valid SEPA Man...
entry.content:
Hello @Katharinam 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, there is no standard workflow that prevents billing if a SEPA mandate exists but is not yet valid. The recommended approach is to use the Manage SEPA Mandates app to Monitor mandate status and, if necessary, create a Custom Analytical Report/CDS View that flags Not yet valid mandates for follow-up. You can also extend this with Situation Handling to proactively notify responsible users.

More helpful SAP Documentation SAP Help – Manage SEPA Mandates

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: ManageSupplierInvoiceIn API - Supplier Invoice not au...
entry.content:
Hello,

I dont think that it would be possible to post the supplier inovice automatically using technical User.
when invocie is created via webservice call, it would be treated as Invoice created using external Application. in which case, it will check if the user has the authorization to post the supplier invoice ( This is determined using the employee work distribution set up).

if user creating the invoce is not maintained as responsible for supplier invoice, system wold not let user release the invoice ( this is true also in case of the manual entry in ByD).

If you would like to release the supplier invoice automatically, you will need to make the web service call using Business User credentials and not the technical User Defined in communication arrangement.

One of the reason for such design could be that when invoice is created using external application or B2B Message, it may not have all the information or some infomration could be incorrect and hence the Employee responsible for supplier invoice needs to validate / Add / Correct information before posting the invocie in the system and creating journal Entry.



Alternate approach here could be to Use ODATA ( Create invoice and the call the FinishDataEntryProcessing method to post the invoice) however here as well, you will have the similar issue as user calling the action FinishDataEntryProcessing needs to be maintained as employee responsible for either all invoicing unit or atleast for the invoicing unit for which invoice is created.


Regards,
Harshal

entry.title: Country Compliance Forms "Notice of Pay Rate" California WTPA form Field Configuration
entry.content:
Introduction

A new law, effective January 1, 2012 which gives greater protection to workers, and makes changes in the way workers are notified of basic employment information.

 

 Workers have to receive the required notice containing specific information at the time of hire.

Notice of Employee - https://www.dir.ca.gov/dlse/lc_2810.5_notice.pdf

 

Pre-requisites

Before proceeding with the following steps, it's necessary to set up the global filter configuration override for assigning the form to new hires. Please refer to the steps outlined in the Global Filter Setup

 

Setting up override configuration for WTPA Form Fields

As previously mentioned, this form doesn't have a standard set of mappings and is not readily usable.

After defining the Global filter, the next step involves configuring overrides for specific fields within the form..

Overrides are required for the following fields. It's crucial to adhere strictly to the overriding field IDs highlighted in the excel snapshot below.

 

 

The above snapshot provides comprehensive customization expectations for each field across all supported WTPA forms. To enhance readability, the excel is divided into multiple sections corresponding to each form line item.

The excel provides detailed information on technical field IDs, Override Field names (for which Override definition should be derived), and the expected data type of the Overriding field.

The Overriding Field Name serves as the key field for mapping the overridden data to the PDF form. It's imperative to strictly adhere to the case-sensitive ID text.

Generic steps apply to each overriding field

The same steps outlined in the NY WTPA form setup blog can be followed for configuring overrides either directly for an existing HRIS (Human Resources Information System) element or via a Business Rule. If a specific field in the HRIS system needs to be overridden, you can do so directly by modifying the field. Alternatively, if the override logic is more complex or requires specific conditions, you can use Business Rules to manage the override.

Additionally, the system supports multiple languages, including Vietnamese, Spanish, Korean, Chinese, and English, ensuring that users can access and work with the setup in their preferred language.

Conclusion:

Completing the described configuration steps is crucial as they are one-time activity and mandatory for proper functionality.

Failure to configure any of the mentioned steps may lead to blank values in the generated PDF forms.

Once all the necessary configurations are completed, new hire will receive the notice in both English and their primary language, provided that the Labor Department offers a translation and it is included in the list of languages supported by SAP SuccessFactors.

Thank you

entry.title: Re: Unable to deploy a CAP app
entry.content: It looks like the error comes from the cds add workzone command trying to read the crossNavigation.inbounds section of your UI5 app’s manifest.json. If that section is missing or malformed, the CLI crashes. You can check your UI5 app’s manifest.json Undersap.app, make sure you have a crossNavigation section with at least one inbound, and  make sure you are on the latest versions of @SAP/cds and @SAP/cds-dk. Outdated versions can cause Work Zone integration errors

entry.title: Re: How to use Cloud SDK for AI in an existing CAP NodeJS Project in CommonJS
entry.content:
Hi @Jacky_Liu1 

Thank you for sharing this detailed article. In addition to the bundler approach you described, there are two other options for integrating ESM modules into a CommonJS project:

Dynamic Import: Use await import() inside an async function:

// In your CommonJS module (e.g. srv/your-service.js)
async function useSdk() {
  const { OrchestrationClient, buildAzureContentSafetyFilter } = await import('@sap-ai-sdk/orchestration');
  // Use OrchestrationClient, buildAzureContentSafetyFilter as normal
  //...
}

// Later in your code
useSdk();

This works in all modern Node.js versions and is straightforward if asynchronous loading fits your use case.

Native `require()` Support (Node.js 22+): Recent Node.js versions support using require() directly with ESM modules (behind --experimental-require-module flag in certain Node.js 22 versions). The ESM module should not use top-level await (which is true for the SAP Cloud SDK for AI packages).

All three methods are valid; dynamic import offers broader compatibility while native require() is becoming the standard.

entry.title: Re: In S4HANA Public Cloud is there any standard report f...
entry.content:
Yes some standard apps are there which you can explore and can be accessed directly via the Fiori Launchpad, provided your user role has the appropriate authorizations. They are

  • Sales Volume – Sales Organization
  • Sales Order Fulfillment Issues
  • Billing Document Items
  • Sales Order Items – Analytical List Page (ALP)
  • Customer Invoice List

If you want a single consolidated view, consider creating a Custom CDS View or using SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) to join data from:

  • Sales Order (VBAK/VBAP)
  • Delivery (LIKP/LIPS)
  • Billing (VBRK/VBRP)

This gives you full traceability with quantity, price, and tax across the cycle.

entry.title: Logon failed for RESTful Web Services. Contact system administrator
entry.content:
Hi guys

I'm having trouble configuring HTTPS access to the BI Launchpad of an SAP BOE system.

The installed product versions are:
SAP BOE 4.3 SP04 Patch 10
Single node system
Windows Server 2022 Operating System
CMS database on a remote Microsoft SQL Server 2022

I initially configured SSO with Active Directory, following SAP Note 2629070 for BI Launchpad and the guide https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/sso-configuration-with-active-directory-sap-business-objects-4-2-aes/ba-p/13222055 for the CMC.

I haven't had any problems: I can log in to both the CMC and the BI Fiori Launchpad in SSO.

I then configured Tomcat for HTTPS access following SAP note 1648573 (but I used the "keytool" format for the keystore).

At this point, I can access the CMC in SSO both in HTTP and in HTTPS without any problems.
Regarding the BI Fiori Launchpad, I have no problems using HTTP in SSO, but when I try to access it using HTTPS (port 8443), I get the following error:

Logon failed for RESTful Web Services. Contact system administrator.

As suggested in note 2576124, I changed the URL reported in the RestFUL web service properties, in the CMC -> Application -> RESTful Web Service, to the value:

https://hostname.domain:8443/biprws

but it didn't resolve the issue.

Since the client's language is French, I also tried changing the REGION of the operating system of the machine on which the CMS runs as explained in SAP note 2944749, but it didn't resolve the issue.

Finally, I tried configuring SSO for RestFul web services as well, as explained in SAP Note 2614257, but it didn't resolve the issue.

Do you have any idea ?
Thank you very much.

entry.title: Re: T549S Query
entry.content:
Hi @Vivekasri 

Date Identifier 05 - ACC: Earliest Doc. Creation Date; represents the earliest document creation date for accounting documents during payroll accrual processing. It acts as a control mechanism to prevent financial postings from being created too far in advance of the actual payroll period, ensuring proper alignment with accounting periods. This is one of the three mandatory dates required in T549S for each payroll ID along with pay date 01 and posting run 04.

To summarize, Date identifiers (dat.ID) are used to distinguish one from the other. Dat.ID 01 often has the meaning that the payday of the payroll period. Period parameter and date modifier: Modifiers for the payroll periods for which generation takes place. On which payroll needs to be generated.

Date Identifier 13 - Payroll Costing EOM Accrual Date; controls the end-of-month accrual date specifically for payroll costing purposes. It works with the month-end accruals functionality that distributes expenses across multiple posting periods when payroll periods overlap with accounting periods, ensuring accurate cost allocation for financial reporting.

Yes, SAP provides standard documentation through the IMG path. You can access it via Payroll → Month end accruals → Triggering Month End Accrual computation. You can access detailed F1 help documentation from this configuration area that explains setup restrictions and provides examples for each date identifier.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Commission Contract: Copy Control for Conditions
entry.content:
SAP's condition record copying function has strict prerequisites:

The condition types must have the same scale type, calculation rule, condition class, and plus/minus indicator.
The condition tables must be compatible—ideally identical, or differing by only one field.

If any of these don't match between RCS1 and RCA1, the system blocks the scale copy and throws W_CB237.

Having said that, since RCS1 is set to Positive and RCA1 set to Negative and meant to represent accruals, which are typically posted as negative amounts. So you are not supposed to change this Plus/Minus sign in configuration.

The recommended approach would be define a temporary condition type let us say ZRCX, with the same config as RCS1—including a Positive for Plus/Minus. Use it to copy scales from RCS1. Then via a custom routine, transfer the copied values to RCA1, adjusting the sign as needed. For this, you also need to develop a custom ABAP routine that bypasses the Plus/Minus check and copies scale data directly.

entry.title: Smarter Quality Management with AI-Assisted Processing - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Managing incoming quality certificates has long been a time-consuming, error-prone process. Manual uploads, mismatched documents, and delays in inspection can create bottlenecks that impact production timelines and even revenue.

With the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release, SAP introduces a game-changing enhancement: AI-assisted processing of quality certificates with SAP Document AI.

This new capability brings automation, accuracy, and intelligence to a critical step in the quality management process.

Why This Matters

Traditionally, quality technicians spend hours uploading, checking, and confirming certificates from suppliers. Even small errors or missing documents can block stock usage decisions, leading to costly delays.

SAP Document AI changes the game by:

  • Automatically extracting data from certificates in multiple formats (PDF, scanned docs, images).
  • Matching certificates to existing receipts using built-in logic.
  • Attaching the document and updating the status automatically.
  • Freeing quality teams to focus on inspections instead of paperwork.

How It Works

The process is seamless:

1. Upload: Certificates are uploaded in the Upload Quality Certificate Documents app.

2. Extract: SAP Document AI extracts key data (PO number, material, supplier).

3. Match: The system checks extracted data against existing certificate receipts.

4. Confirm: If a match is found, the receipt status updates to Received and the document is attached.

5. Automate: New or updated receipts are flagged with automation levels (Created Automatically / Changed Automatically).

Automation Level is set to “Created Automatically” when a new certificate receipt is created. For existing certificate receipt Automation level is set to “Changed Automatically”.

6. Review (Optional): If data is incomplete, quality technicians can manually review and retry matching.

Review the data extracted from the document, such as the purchase order, supplier, or material and the corresponding data in your system that SAP Document AI identified as a match for the extracted data.

   6.1 Manual Review: Extracted data is incomplete or not entirely accurate 
If the system cannot clearly identify or update the certificate receipt (for example, the original paper document may be damaged, or its format may not allow a full extraction), you can review the extracted data and manually complete the matching process.

Manually resolve inconclusive cases in the Review Certificate Document Matches app where you can review and correct the details. When you choose Retry Matching, the system uses this updated data to again find a certificate receipt for the document.

Benefits at a Glance

  • Reduce the time required to process incoming certificates and thereby free up time for quality technicians to focus on their core tasks.
  • Reduce manual efforts and thus process costs.
  • Increase quality mechanisms: No certificates are lost or overlooked.
  • Minimize errors due to incorrectly assigned objects.

Real-World Example

Imagine a supplier delivers raw materials, but the certificate confirmation is missing. Traditionally, production waits until the quality technician manually uploads and verifies the document. With SAP Document AI, the system automatically:

  • Reads the certificate.
  • Matches it to the supplier’s delivery.
  • Updates the inspection lot.
  • Unlocks the material for usage decision.

The Future of Intelligent Quality Management

This enhancement marks a shift from reactive document handling to intelligent, proactive quality assurance. By embedding AI into routine certificate processing, SAP helps organizations:

  • Improve productivity.
  • Reduce risk of human error.
  • Build a foundation for fully automated quality management.

With SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, companies now have a smarter, faster way to ensure product quality and compliance — powered by SAP Document AI.

Further reading:
SAP Document AI — The Roadmap for Seamless Document Processing in SAP Business Suite
